question:
In which Five-Year Plan was the process of economic reforms introduced in India?

SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The process of economic reforms in India was introduced during the Eighth Five-Year Plan (1992–1997).
  • This period marked the beginning of liberalization, privatization, and globalization in the Indian economy.
  • The reforms aimed at reducing government control, encouraging private investment, and integrating India with the global economy.
  • The Eighth Plan focused on improving efficiency and accelerating economic growth through structural changes.
  • It laid the foundation for subsequent reforms in the 1990s.

Additional Information:

  • The economic reforms officially started in 1991 under the leadership of then Finance Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh.
  • The earlier Five-Year Plans focused more on centralized planning and state control of industries.
  • The Eighth Plan reflected a shift towards market-oriented policies to address economic crises.

question:
Which five-year plan emphasized on the development of industries and industrial base In India?

SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The Second Five-Year Plan (1956–1961) emphasized the development of industries and the industrial base in India.
  • It focused on rapid industrialization, especially the growth of heavy industries like steel, coal, and machinery.
  • The plan was based on the ideas of Nehru and Mahalanobis, focusing on a socialist pattern of development.
  • The aim was to build a strong industrial foundation to support future economic growth.
  • It marked a shift from agriculture-based development to industrial-led growth.

Additional Information:

  • The plan gave priority to the public sector for establishing industries.
  • It aimed at self-reliance by producing capital goods domestically.
  • The Mahalanobis model played a key role in shaping the industrial strategy of this plan.

question:
Why is PC Mahalanobis' name talked about in the context of Five-Year Plans?

SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (4th shift)
option_1: He was the chairman of the Planning Commission
option_2: He established the Institute of Economic Growth
option_3: He conceptualized the framework for the Second Five-Year Plan
option_4: He was the finance minister during the First Five-Year Plan period
solution:
• PC Mahalanobis is renowned for conceptualizing the framework of the Second Five-Year Plan.
  • He introduced the Mahalanobis Model, which emphasized the development of the industrial sector, especially heavy industries.
  • His model focused on building a strong industrial base to accelerate economic growth in India.
  • The plan aimed at long-term economic growth through investments in capital goods industries.
  • Mahalanobis' work significantly influenced India's industrialization strategy during the early planning years.

Additional Information:

  • He was also the founder of the Indian Statistical Institute (ISI).
  • Although he was not the chairman of the Planning Commission, his economic ideas shaped the country’s planning process.
  • The Mahalanobis model balanced investment between capital goods and consumer goods sectors to optimize growth.

question:
In Five year plans, Plan Holiday is from ______________ .

SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The Plan Holiday period in India was from 1966 to 1969.
  • During this time, regular Five-Year Plans were suspended due to economic difficulties caused by wars, droughts, and inflation.
  • Instead of a full plan, the government implemented Annual Plans to manage the economy.
  • This break allowed the government to stabilize the economy before launching the next full Five-Year Plan.
  • The Plan Holiday followed the end of the Third Five-Year Plan.

Additional Information:

  • The Indo-China War (1962) and Indo-Pak War (1965) affected economic stability.
  • Poor monsoon seasons in the mid-1960s worsened agricultural output.
  • The Plan Holiday ended with the launch of the Fourth Five-Year Plan in 1969.

question:
When did the first 5 year plan start?

SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The First Five-Year Plan of India started on 1 April 1951.
  • It focused primarily on the development of the agricultural sector and irrigation projects.
  • The plan aimed at increasing food production to address the food shortages in the country.
  • It laid the foundation for planned economic development after India’s independence.
  • This plan was based on the Harrod-Domar growth model, emphasizing investment in the agricultural sector.

Additional Information:

  • The First Plan lasted from 1951 to 1956.
  • It also emphasized the development of power and transport sectors.
  • It marked the beginning of India’s planned economy under the Planning Commission.

question:
Which of the Five-Year Plans was prepared and launched by DP Dhar?

SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The Fifth Five-Year Plan (1974–1979) was prepared and launched under the leadership of DP Dhar.
  • This plan aimed at removing poverty and achieving self-reliance in food production.
  • It focused on the modernization of agriculture and promotion of rural development.
  • The Fifth Plan also emphasized the importance of technology and social justice.
  • It was a period marked by efforts to improve the quality of life for the poor.

Additional Information:

  • The Fifth Plan was interrupted by the Emergency period (1975–1977) but continued its focus on poverty alleviation.
  • It prioritized employment generation and increase in national income.
  • DP Dhar was an important advisor to the government during this plan period.

question:
Which five year plan aimed to increase the rapid growth in food grains production?

SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (2nd shift)
option_1: Seventh Five Year Plan
option_2: Eighth Five Year Plan
option_3: Sixth Five Year Plan
option_4: Fifth Five Year Plan
solution:
• The Seventh Five-Year Plan (1985–1990) aimed to achieve rapid growth in food grains production.
  • It focused on increasing agricultural productivity to ensure food security for the growing population.
  • The plan emphasized the use of modern technology, improved irrigation, and better seeds to boost production.
  • It also aimed at strengthening rural infrastructure and providing support to farmers.
  • The Seventh Plan sought to reduce dependence on food imports by promoting self-sufficiency in food grains.

Additional Information:

  • The Green Revolution’s impact was consolidated during this plan.
  • The plan also aimed at balanced regional development in agriculture.
  • It marked a continuation of efforts to modernize Indian agriculture.

question:
___________ was the chairman of the planning commission when the first five year plan was formulated in India.

SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• Jawaharlal Nehru was the chairman of the Planning Commission when the First Five-Year Plan was formulated in India.
  • As the first Prime Minister of India, he played a pivotal role in shaping the country’s planned economic development.
  • Nehru emphasized the importance of industrialization and scientific progress alongside agriculture.
  • Under his leadership, the Planning Commission was established in 1950 to guide India’s economic planning.
  • His vision laid the foundation for India’s transition to a mixed economy.

Additional Information:

  • The Planning Commission was an important institution for formulating and monitoring plans.
  • Nehru’s policies focused on self-reliance and modernization of India’s economy.
  • He continued to influence the planning process throughout the early decades after independence.

question:
What was the prime target of the first five - year plan of India?

SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The prime target of the First Five-Year Plan (1951–1956) was the development of agriculture.
  • The plan focused on increasing food production to tackle food shortages and improve rural livelihoods.
  • Emphasis was placed on irrigation projects, land reforms, and rural development.
  • It aimed to achieve self-sufficiency in food grains.
  • The plan laid the foundation for future economic development by securing the agricultural base.

Additional Information:

  • The First Plan allocated significant resources to power and transport sectors as well.
  • It was based on the Harrod-Domar growth model which stressed investment in agriculture.
  • This plan was critical for stabilizing the newly independent economy.

question:
Harrod Domar growth model is known for highlighting the role of savings and investments. Which Five-Year Plan in India was based on this model?

SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The First Five-Year Plan (1951–1956) of India was based on the Harrod-Domar growth model.
  • This model emphasizes the importance of savings and investments for economic growth.
  • It focuses on how investment in capital goods can lead to increased production capacity.
  • The plan prioritized investment in agriculture and irrigation to boost food production.
  • It laid the foundation for planned economic development in newly independent India.

Additional Information:

  • The Harrod-Domar model helped in understanding the need for a minimum level of savings to sustain growth.
  • It influenced early Indian economic policies focusing on capital formation.
  • The model assumes that the economy grows through a linear relationship between investment and output.

question:
What were the primary goals of the five-year plans in India?

SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
option_1: Industrialisation, Urbanisation, development and self-reliance
option_2: Poverty reduction, Urbanisation, Self-sufficiency and Modernisation
option_3: Social welfare, Self-sufficiency, equity and industrial development
option_4: Growth, modernisation, self-reliance and equity
solution:
• The primary goals of the Five-Year Plans in India were growth, modernization, self-reliance, and equity.
  • These plans aimed to achieve sustained economic growth through planned development.
  • Modernization involved adopting new technologies and improving infrastructure.
  • Self-reliance focused on reducing dependency on foreign goods and promoting indigenous production.
  • Equity ensured fair distribution of resources and reduction of poverty and inequalities.

Additional Information:

  • The Five-Year Plans aimed to balance economic growth with social justice.
  • They focused on sectors like agriculture, industry, education, and health.
  • The concept of planned economic development was central to India’s strategy post-independence.

question:
Choose the correct pair from the following options.

SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
option_1: Third Five-year Plan - Rapid industrialisation and basic industries
option_2: Fourth Five-year Plan - Family planning programme

Let’s examine each option:

(a) Third Five-year Plan – Rapid industrialisation and basic industries ❌

  • Incorrect.
  • The Second Five-Year Plan focused on rapid industrialization and basic industries, guided by the Mahalanobis model.
  • The Third Plan (1961–66) emphasized agriculture and improving self-sufficiency in food grains, along with defense preparedness after the 1962 war.

(b) Fourth Five-year Plan – Family planning programme ✅

  • Correct.
  • The Fourth Plan (1969–1974) placed strong emphasis on population control, introducing a structured family planning programme.
  • It also aimed at growth with stability and progressive achievement of self-reliance.

(c) First Five-year Plan – Mahalanobis model ❌

  • Incorrect.
  • The First Plan (1951–56) was based on the Harrod-Domar model and prioritized agriculture, irrigation, and power.
  • The Mahalanobis model was adopted in the Second Plan.

(d) Second Five-year Plan – Focus on agriculture ❌

  • Incorrect.
  • The Second Plan (1956–61) focused on industrial development, especially heavy and basic industries, not agriculture.

Thus, only Option (b) is the correct match.

question:
For the first time the objective of self-reliance was incorporated in the _____________ Five-Year Plan.

SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• The objective of self-reliance was incorporated for the first time in the Third Five-Year Plan (1961–1966).
  • This plan emphasized reducing dependence on foreign countries by promoting domestic production and strengthening basic and heavy industries.
  • It aimed at building a self-sufficient economy to support sustainable growth.
  • The Third Plan focused on the development of science and technology to achieve self-reliance.
  • It laid the foundation for India’s long-term industrial and economic independence.

Additional Information:

  • Earlier plans focused more on agricultural growth and industrialization without explicitly emphasizing self-reliance.
  • The concept of self-reliance became crucial after geopolitical tensions and economic challenges in the 1960s.
  • The Third Plan also sought to balance growth with social justice.

question:
In 2015, the Planning Commission was replaced with the ______________.

SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (4th Shift)
option_2: Competition Commission of India
solution:
• In 2015, the Planning Commission was replaced by NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India).
  • NITI Aayog was established to serve as a think tank and provide strategic and technical advice to the central and state governments.
  • It aims to promote cooperative federalism and involve states in the decision-making process.
  • Unlike the Planning Commission, NITI Aayog focuses on sustainable development, innovation, and technology-driven growth.
  • It emphasizes bottom-up planning and policy design based on local needs.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog was formed under the leadership of the then Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • It works on long-term policy frameworks rather than fixed Five-Year Plans.
  • The change aimed to make planning more flexible and adaptive to current economic challenges.

question:
Which Five-Year Plan in India was mainly focussed on Garibi Hatao, creation of employment opportunities and agricultural production amongst other objectives?

SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• The Fifth Five-Year Plan (1974–1979) mainly focused on Garibi Hatao (poverty eradication), creation of employment opportunities, and increasing agricultural production.
  • It aimed to reduce poverty by improving the economic conditions of the poor and promoting social justice.
  • The plan emphasized rural development, modernization of agriculture, and expansion of the industrial sector.
  • It sought to create more job opportunities to tackle unemployment.
  • The Fifth Plan was a continuation of the government’s efforts towards inclusive growth.

Additional Information:

  • The slogan "Garibi Hatao" was popularized by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.
  • This plan also focused on self-reliance and strengthening the public sector.
  • The plan was implemented during a politically turbulent period including the Emergency (1975-77).

question:
What was the duration of the Rolling Plan in India?

SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• The Rolling Plan in India was implemented from 1978 to 1980.
  • It was introduced after the Plan Holiday period when the regular Five-Year Plans were suspended.
  • Unlike fixed-term plans, the Rolling Plan was a flexible and continuous plan, updated annually.
  • It aimed to adapt planning to the changing economic situation and government priorities.
  • The Rolling Plan allowed more responsive and dynamic economic planning during a transitional period.

Additional Information:

  • The Rolling Plan replaced the interrupted Fifth Plan after the Emergency period (1975–1977).
  • It paved the way for the Sixth Five-Year Plan starting in 1980.
  • This approach was intended to reduce rigidities in economic planning.

question:
Growth with stability and progressive achievement of self-reliance was the objective of the _____________ Five-Year Plan.

SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
solution:
• The objective of growth with stability and progressive achievement of self-reliance was central to the Fourth Five-Year Plan (1969–1974).
  • This plan focused on achieving steady economic growth while maintaining price stability.
  • It aimed at reducing inflation and ensuring balanced regional development.
  • The plan emphasized strengthening the agricultural sector and promoting industrial growth.
  • It continued the effort to make India self-reliant by boosting domestic production.

Additional Information:

  • The Fourth Plan was interrupted by political and economic challenges but laid important groundwork for future plans.
  • It included programs for family planning and social justice.
  • The plan marked a shift towards more balanced development across sectors.

question:
What is NOT a goal of Five-Year Plans?

SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)
option_3: Equal benefits to all the people
solution:
• High Population Growth is NOT a goal of the Five-Year Plans.
  • The plans aim to control and stabilize population growth through various family planning programs.
  • The key goals include achieving high GDP growth, ensuring equal benefits to all sections of society, and promoting self-reliance.
  • Five-Year Plans focus on sustainable economic development and social equity.
  • Controlling population growth is seen as essential to achieving overall development objectives.

Additional Information:

  • Family planning and health programs have been integral parts of the plans.
  • Rapid population growth is considered a challenge to economic progress.
  • The plans aim to improve quality of life by managing demographic factors.

question:
Before being replaced by NITI Aayog, which organization was responsible for collecting data about unemployment Using Lakdawala Formula?

SSC MTS 07/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution:
• Before being replaced by NITI Aayog, the Planning Commission was responsible for collecting data about unemployment using the Lakdawala Formula.
  • The Lakdawala Formula was a method used to estimate unemployment rates in India.
  • The Planning Commission used this data to assess labor market conditions and plan economic policies.
  • It helped in understanding the extent of open unemployment and underemployment in the country.
  • This data was important for designing employment generation schemes in the Five-Year Plans.

Additional Information:

  • The Planning Commission was established in 1950 and functioned until 2015.
  • The Lakdawala Committee was set up to improve the measurement of unemployment.
  • After 2015, NITI Aayog took over the functions of the Planning Commission but with a different approach.

question:
IPR 1956 formed the basis of the ___________ Five Year Plan of India.

SSC CGL 18/08/2021 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The Industrial Policy Resolution (IPR) 1956 formed the basis of the Second Five-Year Plan (1956–1961) of India.
  • The IPR 1956 laid emphasis on the development of the public sector and classified industries into three categories: exclusive state control, state and private control, and private sector control.
  • It aimed to accelerate industrialization, especially in heavy and basic industries.
  • The Second Plan focused on building a strong industrial base following the guidelines of IPR 1956.
  • This policy played a key role in shaping India’s mixed economy.

Additional Information:

  • The IPR 1956 advocated a socialist pattern of development.
  • It led to the establishment of many public sector undertakings (PSUs).
  • The policy sought to reduce dependence on imports through self-reliant industrial growth.

question:
Which type of seeds played an important role in the Green Revolution in India?

SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• High Yielding Variety (HYV) seeds played an important role in the Green Revolution in India.
  • These seeds were developed to produce significantly higher crop yields compared to traditional varieties.
  • HYV seeds, combined with improved irrigation, fertilizers, and pesticides, helped increase food grain production drastically.
  • The introduction of HYV seeds led to self-sufficiency in food grains and reduced dependence on imports.
  • This revolution primarily benefited crops like wheat and rice.

Additional Information:

  • The Green Revolution started in the 1960s and transformed Indian agriculture.
  • It helped prevent famines and improved rural incomes.
  • The use of HYV seeds is still a key component of modern agriculture in India.

question:
Who among the following is the chairman of NITI Aayog?

SSC MTS 22/10/2021 (Morning)
solution:
• The Chairman of NITI Aayog is the Prime Minister of India.
  • Currently, Narendra Modi is the Chairman of NITI Aayog.
  • NITI Aayog was established in 2015 to replace the Planning Commission.
  • It serves as a policy think tank to promote cooperative federalism and sustainable development.
  • The Chairman guides the strategic vision and policies of the organization.

Additional Information:

  • The Vice Chairman and CEO assist in the functioning of NITI Aayog.
  • NITI Aayog focuses on long-term policy planning rather than fixed Five-Year Plans.
  • It works closely with states and union territories for inclusive growth.

question:
Who among the following economists coined the terminology 'Hindu Rate of Growth'?

SSC CGL 13/08/2021 (Evening)
solution:
• The term 'Hindu Rate of Growth' was coined by economist Raj Krishna.
  • It refers to the low annual growth rate of the Indian economy, approximately 5%, observed between the 1950s and 1980s.
  • The term highlighted the sluggish economic growth under the socialist-inspired economic policies.
  • Raj Krishna used this term to critique the slow progress despite India’s planning efforts.
  • It motivated policymakers to initiate economic reforms in the 1990s.

Additional Information:

  • The term does not relate to religion but to economic stagnation.
  • The "Hindu Rate of Growth" period ended with liberalization in 1991.
  • Raj Krishna was a prominent economist and academic.

question:
A Plan of Economic Development for India' is also known as ___________ .

SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• "A Plan of Economic Development for India" is also known as the Bombay Plan.
  • It was formulated in 1944 by a group of leading industrialists from Bombay (now Mumbai).
  • The plan emphasized the role of the private sector in economic development.
  • It proposed significant investment in industries, agriculture, and infrastructure post-independence.
  • The Bombay Plan aimed to guide India’s transition to a mixed economy.

Additional Information:

  • Key contributors included J.R.D. Tata, G.D. Birla, and other prominent businessmen.
  • The plan supported state intervention alongside private enterprise.
  • It influenced the economic policies adopted after India’s independence in 1947.

question:
Who was the Chairman of the Fifteenth Finance Commission of India?

SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution:
• The Chairman of the Fifteenth Finance Commission of India was N. K. Singh.
  • He served from November 27, 2017, to November 26, 2023.
  • Prior to this, he held significant positions, including Revenue Secretary, Expenditure Secretary, and Secretary to the Prime Minister.
  • He also served as a Member of Parliament (Rajya Sabha) from 2008 to 2014.
  • N. K. Singh played a pivotal role in shaping India's fiscal federalism and public finance strategies.

Additional Information:

  • The Fifteenth Finance Commission was tasked with recommending the distribution of net proceeds of taxes between the Union and the States, among other fiscal matters.
  • Under his leadership, the Commission emphasized strengthening cooperative federalism and improving the quality of public spending.
  • The Commission's recommendations covered the period from April 1, 2020, to March 31, 2025.

question:
Who released a special stamp entitled 'Wheat Revolution' in July 1968?

SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• The special stamp entitled 'Wheat Revolution' was released in July 1968 to commemorate the Green Revolution in India, which greatly increased wheat production.
  • Indira Gandhi, then the Prime Minister of India, played a key role in promoting agricultural reforms and the Green Revolution.
  • She was the one who released the stamp to honor the success of this agricultural transformation.
  • Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru, and Motilal Nehru were not associated with the release of this stamp.
  • The Green Revolution helped India achieve self-sufficiency in food grains, especially wheat.

Additional Information:

  • The Green Revolution began in the 1960s and involved the introduction of high-yielding variety (HYV) seeds, improved irrigation, and use of fertilizers.
  • Indira Gandhi’s leadership was crucial during this period to boost agricultural productivity.

question:
The Green Revolution in India was initiated by MS Swaminathan in ______________ .

Graduate Level 04/08/2022 (Shift - 2)
solution:
• The Green Revolution in India was primarily initiated in the 1960s to increase agricultural production through modern techniques.
  • MS Swaminathan is known as the Father of the Green Revolution in India due to his pioneering work in developing high-yielding varieties of wheat and rice.
  • The introduction of high-yielding variety (HYV) seeds, combined with better irrigation and fertilizers, helped India overcome food shortages during this period.
  • The 1960s marked a significant shift in Indian agriculture towards more scientific and efficient farming methods.
  • The Green Revolution laid the foundation for India's self-sufficiency in food grains.

Additional Information:

  • MS Swaminathan's efforts in the 1960s played a crucial role in transforming Indian agriculture.
  • The Green Revolution helped India avoid famines and food crises prevalent before this period.

question:
The Fifteenth Finance Commission was constituted in:

SSC CHSL 08/06/2022 (Morning)
solution:
• The Fifteenth Finance Commission of India was constituted in 2017.
  • Finance Commissions are set up every five years to recommend the distribution of tax revenues between the central government and the states.
  • The Fifteenth Finance Commission was tasked with making recommendations for the period from 2020 to 2025.
  • It was chaired by N.K. Singh.
  • The commission plays a crucial role in fiscal federalism by ensuring equitable resource allocation.

Additional Information:

  • The Finance Commission is a constitutional body established under Article 280 of the Indian Constitution.
  • The Fifteenth Finance Commission’s recommendations have significant impact on the financial relations between the Centre and states.

question:
In the year __________, Indira Gandhi, the then Prime Minister of India, issued special stamps titled 'Wheat Revolution' to usher in the Green Revolution.

SSC CGL 18/04/2022 (Evening)
solution:
• The special stamps titled 'Wheat Revolution' were issued in the year 1968 by Indira Gandhi, who was then the Prime Minister of India.
  • This issuance was to mark the beginning and success of the Green Revolution in India, which greatly enhanced wheat production.
  • The Green Revolution helped India achieve self-sufficiency in food grains during the late 1960s.
  • Indira Gandhi’s leadership was instrumental in promoting agricultural advancements during this period.
  • The year 1968 is significant as it symbolizes the official recognition of agricultural transformation in India.

Additional Information:

  • The Green Revolution involved the use of high-yielding variety (HYV) seeds, fertilizers, and improved irrigation techniques.
  • The success of this revolution helped India reduce dependency on food imports.

question:
Who among the following has served as the Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission of India?

SSC MTS 14/10/2021 (Evening)
solution:
• Pranab Mukherjee served as the Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission of India.
  • The Planning Commission was a key institution in India responsible for formulating five-year plans and guiding economic development.
  • Pranab Mukherjee held the Deputy Chairman position from 1991 to 1996.
  • He played a significant role in policy formulation and planning during his tenure.
  • The Planning Commission was later replaced by the NITI Aayog in 2015.

Additional Information:

  • Pranab Mukherjee also served as the President of India from 2012 to 2017.
  • Other options like Ramaswamy Venkataraman, Pratibha Patil, and Giani Zail Singh have held other prominent positions but were not Deputy Chairmen of the Planning Commission.

question:
What is the main objective of the Twelfth Five Year Plan?

IAS, 2014
option_1: Inclusive growth and poverty reduction
option_2: Inclusive and sustainable growth
option_3: Sustainable and inclusive growth to reduce unemployment
option_4: Faster, sustainable and more inclusive growth
solution:
• The main objective of the Twelfth Five Year Plan (2012–2017) was to achieve faster, sustainable, and more inclusive growth.
  • This plan emphasized the need for rapid economic growth while ensuring environmental sustainability and social inclusion.
  • It aimed to improve the quality of life for all sections of society, reducing disparities and promoting equitable development.
  • The plan focused on sectors like agriculture, infrastructure, education, health, and employment generation.
  • Ensuring that growth benefits reached marginalized and vulnerable groups was a key priority.

Additional Information:

  • The Twelfth Plan was prepared by the Planning Commission before its dissolution in 2015.
  • It aligned with the goals of sustainable development and the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs).

question:
The twenty point economic program was first started in the year-

UPPSC (Mains), 2009
solution:
• The Twenty Point Economic Program was first started in the year 1975.
  • It was launched by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi as a comprehensive socio-economic reform plan.
  • The program aimed to address poverty, unemployment, and promote social justice through various economic measures.
  • It included initiatives related to land reforms, price control, housing, and rural development.
  • This program played an important role in India’s economic policy during the mid-1970s.

Additional Information:

  • The program was reintroduced and modified several times in subsequent years due to its importance.
  • It was designed to improve the living standards of the poor and weaker sections of society.

question:
What was the priority of the first five year plan?

UPPSC (Mains), 2011
solution:
• The priority of the First Five Year Plan (1951-1956) was the development of agriculture.
  • After independence, India faced severe food shortages, making agricultural development critical for economic stability.
  • The plan focused on increasing food production through irrigation projects, land reforms, and improving agricultural practices.
  • This emphasis aimed to ensure food security and support rural livelihoods.
  • Investment in agriculture was considered essential for overall economic growth in the initial phase of planning.

Additional Information:

  • The First Five Year Plan was largely based on the Harrod-Domar model emphasizing investment in agriculture and irrigation.
  • It achieved significant progress in increasing food grain production and irrigation facilities.

question:
Match the following schemes and programmes :

PlanProgram

A. First Plan Rapid industrialization

B. Second Plan 2. Community development

C. Third Plan 3. Expansion of basic industries

D. Fourth Plan 4. Minimum needs programme

E. Fifth Plan5. Growth with stability and attainment of self-reliance

UPPSC (Pre), 1994

Code:

ABCDE
option_1: 12345
option_2: 21453
option_3: 21345
option_4: 21354
solution:
• The correct matching of the Five Year Plans with their respective programs is:
    • A. First Plan → 2. Community development
    • B. Second Plan → 1. Rapid industrialization
    • C. Third Plan → 3. Expansion of basic industries
    • D. Fourth Plan → 5. Growth with stability and attainment of self-reliance
    • E. Fifth Plan → 4. Minimum needs programme
  • This matching reflects the focus areas of each plan:
    • The First Plan emphasized community development and agriculture.
    • The Second Plan prioritized rapid industrialization.
    • The Third Plan focused on the expansion of basic industries.
    • The Fourth Plan aimed at growth with stability and self-reliance.
    • The Fifth Plan introduced the minimum needs programme to improve living standards.

Additional Information:

  • The Minimum Needs Programme aimed to provide essential services like health, education, housing, and water supply.
  • Each plan reflected the evolving priorities of India’s economic development.

question:
When was the planned development model implemented in India?

UKPSC, 2012
option_1: (a) From 1 April, 1951
option_2: (b) From 15 August, 1947
option_3: (c) From 26 January, 1950
option_4: (d) From 1 May, 1965
solution:
• The planned development model in India was implemented from 1 April, 1951.
  • This marked the beginning of the First Five Year Plan, India's first attempt at planned economic development.
  • The Planning Commission was established to formulate and oversee these plans.
  • The aim was to guide the economy through structured goals, especially focusing on agriculture, industry, and infrastructure.
  • This model laid the foundation for India’s economic growth strategy post-independence.

Additional Information:

  • The First Five Year Plan lasted from 1951 to 1956.
  • Planned development helped India tackle issues like food shortage and economic disparity.

question:
On which model was the Second Five Year Plan based?

MPPSC, 2015
option_1: (a) Solow Model
option_2: (b) Domar Model
option_3: (c) Robinson Model
option_4: (d) Mahalanobis Model
solution:
• The Second Five Year Plan of India was based on the Mahalanobis Model.
  • This model was designed by P.C. Mahalanobis, an Indian statistician and economist.
  • The plan emphasized rapid industrialization, particularly focusing on the development of heavy industries and capital goods.
  • The Mahalanobis Model aimed to build a strong industrial base to support long-term economic growth.
  • It advocated a strategy of import substitution and self-reliance through the expansion of basic industries.

Additional Information:

  • The plan focused on public sector investment as the engine of growth.
  • It marked a shift from agriculture-focused development to industrial-led growth.

question:
The Five Year Plan is finally approved (.....).

CGPSC 2002
option_1: By the Union Cabinet
option_2: By the President on the suggestion of the Prime Minister
option_3: By the Planning Commission
option_4: By the National Development Council
solution:
• The Five Year Plan is finally approved by the National Development Council (NDC).
  • The NDC is the apex body responsible for policy-making and approval of development plans in India.
  • It consists of the Prime Minister, Union Cabinet ministers, Chief Ministers of states, and members of the Planning Commission (now NITI Aayog).
  • The Planning Commission prepares the draft plan, but final approval rests with the NDC to ensure consensus among states and the central government.
  • This process ensures cooperative federalism in the planning process.

Additional Information:

  • The National Development Council was established in 1952.
  • It plays a key role in harmonizing the development priorities of the Centre and the states.

question:
Consider the following statements with reference to Indian Planning:

The Second Five Year Plan emphasised on setting up of heavy industries.

2. The Third Five Year Plan introduced the concept of import substitution as a strategy for industrialisation.

Which of the above statements is/are correct?

IAS, 2009
option_1: (a) Only 1
option_2: (b) Only 2
option_3: (c) Both 1 and 2
option_4: (d) Neither 1 nor 2
solution:
• Statement 1 is correct: The Second Five Year Plan emphasized the setting up of heavy industries as the foundation for India’s industrial development.
  • Statement 2 is correct: The Third Five Year Plan introduced the concept of import substitution as a strategy to promote industrialization and reduce dependence on foreign goods.
  • Import substitution encouraged the production of goods domestically that were previously imported.
  • Both plans contributed significantly to India’s industrial growth and economic planning.
  • Hence, both statements 1 and 2 are correct.

Additional Information:

  • The Second Plan was based on the Mahalanobis Model, focusing on capital goods industries.
  • The Third Plan aimed at growth with stability and employment generation.

question:
Planning Commission has been created in India-

UK UDA/LDA, 2003
option_2: Under an Act of Parliament
option_3: By a resolution of the Cabinet
option_4: By a resolution of the Lok Sabha
solution:
• The Planning Commission in India was created by a resolution of the Cabinet in 1950.
  • It was not established under the Constitution or by an Act of Parliament.
  • The Commission was set up to formulate India’s Five Year Plans and coordinate the country’s economic development.
  • It functioned as an advisory body to the government until it was replaced by NITI Aayog in 2015.
  • The Cabinet resolution gave the Planning Commission its mandate and structure.

Additional Information:

  • The Planning Commission played a vital role in India’s planned economy for over six decades.
  • It was headed by the Prime Minister as the ex-officio chairman.

question:
In which year was the Planning Commission established in India?

BPSC, 2011
solution:
• The Planning Commission of India was established in the year 1950.
  • It was created on 15 March 1950 by a cabinet resolution.
  • The commission was responsible for formulating five-year plans to guide India’s economic development.
  • Jawaharlal Nehru, the first Prime Minister of India, was the first chairman of the Planning Commission.
  • The Planning Commission played a key role in India’s planned economy until it was replaced by NITI Aayog in 2015.

Additional Information:

  • The establishment of the Planning Commission marked the beginning of centralized economic planning in India.
  • It was tasked with assessing resources and formulating strategies for balanced growth.

question:
NITI Aayog was formed in place of Planning Commission –

CGPSC, 2014
option_1: (a) On 1st January, 2015
option_2: (b) On 26th January, 2015
option_3: (c) On 31st January, 2015
option_4: (d) None of these
solution:
• NITI Aayog was formed in place of the Planning Commission on 1st January, 2015.
  • It was established by the Government of India to serve as a policy think tank and foster cooperative federalism.
  • NITI Aayog aims to involve states more closely in the economic policy-making process.
  • Unlike the Planning Commission, NITI Aayog is not responsible for formulating Five Year Plans.
  • It focuses on strategic and long-term policy frameworks and monitoring their implementation.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog stands for National Institution for Transforming India.
  • It was created to address the limitations of the Planning Commission and promote bottom-up planning.

question:
Which one of the following statements is correct regarding the Planning Commission in India?

JPSC, 2013
option_1: There is no mention of Planning Commission in the Constitution
option_2: There is no fixed tenure for its Vice-Chairman and members
option_3: There is no fixed qualification prescribed for its members
option_4: All of the above
solution:
• All of the above statements are correct regarding the Planning Commission in India:
    • (a) The Planning Commission is not mentioned in the Constitution of India.
    • (b) There is no fixed tenure for the Vice-Chairman and members of the Planning Commission.
    • (c) There is no fixed qualification prescribed for its members.
  • The Planning Commission was created by a cabinet resolution, not by a constitutional provision or an act of Parliament.
  • These features gave the government flexibility in appointing members and defining their terms.

Additional Information:

  • The Planning Commission was replaced by NITI Aayog in 2015, which also functions as a policy think tank.
  • The absence of constitutional backing was a key reason for its replacement.

question:
Which of the following is/are associated with planning in India?

Finance Commission

2. National Development Council

3. Federal Ministry of Rural Development

4. Federal Ministry of Urban Development

5. Parliament

Select the correct answer using the code given below:

IAS, 2014
option_1: (a) Only 1,2 and 5
option_2: (b) Only 1,3 and 4
option_3: (c) Only 2 and 5
option_4: (d) All of the above
solution:
• Among the options, only the National Development Council (NDC) and the Parliament are directly associated with planning in India.
  • The Finance Commission deals with the distribution of financial resources between the Centre and the States, not directly with economic planning.
  • The Federal Ministries of Rural and Urban Development implement policies but are not involved in the formulation or approval of the overall plan.
  • The National Development Council approves the Five Year Plans and acts as a forum for discussion between the Centre and States.
  • The Parliament approves the budget and legislation related to economic plans.

Additional Information:

  • The Planning Commission (now replaced by NITI Aayog) was the primary body responsible for drafting plans.
  • The NDC played a crucial role in final approval and coordination among states.

question:
Who suggested the 'Rolling Plan' for backward countries?

UPPSC (Mains), 2004
option_1: (a) By G. Myrdal
option_2: (b) By W.A. Lewis
option_3: (c) By R. Nurkse
option_4: (d) By A. Samuelson
solution:
• The concept of the 'Rolling Plan' for backward countries was suggested by Gunnar Myrdal.
  • Gunnar Myrdal was a Swedish economist known for his work on development economics and planning.
  • The Rolling Plan is a flexible planning method where plans are revised and extended periodically based on changing circumstances.
  • This approach was recommended for developing countries to adapt quickly to economic changes and uncertainties.
  • It contrasts with the fixed-term Five Year Plans traditionally used in India.

Additional Information:

  • Rolling Plans allow continuous assessment and adjustment of goals.
  • This concept influenced economic planning in several developing nations.

question:
Inclusive growth as formulated in the Eleventh Five Year Plan does not include which one of the following?

IAS, 2010
solution:
• Inclusive growth as formulated in the Eleventh Five Year Plan focused on reducing poverty, expanding employment opportunities, and reducing gender inequality.
  • However, strengthening capital markets was not specifically included as part of the objectives of inclusive growth in that plan.
  • The main aim was to ensure that economic growth benefits all sections of society, especially the marginalized and vulnerable.
  • Strengthening capital markets is important for economic development but was treated as a separate financial sector objective, not directly under inclusive growth.
  • Thus, option (c) Strengthening capital markets is the correct answer.

Additional Information:

  • The Eleventh Plan emphasized social equity along with economic growth.
  • It included schemes to improve health, education, and social welfare for disadvantaged groups.

question:
In which one of the following Five Year Plans, human development has been considered the essence of all development efforts?

IAS, 1995
option_1: Third Five Year Plan
option_2: Fifth Five Year Plan
option_3: Sixth Five Year Plan
option_4: Eighth Five Year Plan
solution:
• The Eighth Five Year Plan (1992-1997) considered human development as the essence of all development efforts.
  • This plan shifted focus from merely economic growth to improving human capabilities and quality of life.
  • It emphasized education, health, nutrition, and social welfare as key components of development.
  • The Eighth Plan aimed at inclusive growth by addressing poverty and unemployment along with human development indicators.
  • This marked a significant shift towards recognizing human development as central to national progress.

Additional Information:

  • The Human Development approach was influenced by the work of economists like Amartya Sen.
  • The Eighth Plan laid the foundation for future policies focusing on social sectors.

question:
Which one of the following statements about NITI Aayog is not correct?

UP Lower Sub (Pre)
option_1: It was formed in place of the Planning Commission
option_2: It has a full-time chairman
option_3: It was formed in January 2015
option_4: It is based on the principle of cooperative federalism
solution:
• The incorrect statement about NITI Aayog is:
    • (b) It has a full-time chairman.
  • NITI Aayog is chaired by the Prime Minister of India, who is not a full-time chairman solely dedicated to NITI Aayog.
  • The Prime Minister acts as the ex-officio chairman, while a Vice Chairman and full-time members manage day-to-day functions.
  • Statements (a), (c), and (d) are correct:
    • NITI Aayog was formed in place of the Planning Commission.
    • It was established in January 2015.
    • It is based on the principle of cooperative federalism, involving states in policy-making.

Additional Information:

  • The Vice Chairman of NITI Aayog is a full-time position.
  • NITI Aayog encourages bottom-up planning and state participation.

question:
The Government of India has established NITI Aayog to replace which of the following?

IAS, 2011
solution:
• The Government of India established NITI Aayog to replace the Planning Commission.
  • The Planning Commission, which was created in 1950, was replaced by NITI Aayog in 2015 to promote cooperative federalism and more flexible policy planning.
  • NITI Aayog serves as a policy think tank and aims to involve states more closely in economic development.
  • It focuses on strategic and long-term planning rather than fixed Five Year Plans.
  • The replacement was done to overcome limitations of the Planning Commission and adapt to the evolving economic landscape.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog stands for National Institution for Transforming India.
  • It was formed to encourage bottom-up planning and innovation in governance.

question:
Economic planning is a subject of-

UP Lower Sub (Pre), 2002
option_1: In the Concurrent List
option_2: In the State List
option_3: In the Union List
option_4: Not specified in any list
solution:
• Economic planning is a subject listed in the Concurrent List of the Indian Constitution.
  • This means both the Central Government and the State Governments have the authority to make laws and implement policies related to economic planning.
  • The Concurrent List allows cooperative federalism where both levels of government can work together on planning and development.
  • Economic planning involves formulating policies for resource allocation, development programs, and economic growth strategies.
  • This shared responsibility ensures coordinated efforts across the country.

Additional Information:

  • Other subjects in the Concurrent List include education, forests, and trade unions.
  • In case of conflict, the Central law prevails over the State law in Concurrent List subjects.

question: Who among the following is the chairman of NITI Aayog?
option_2: Prime Minister of India
option_4: Speaker of Lok Sabha
solution:
• The chairman of NITI Aayog is the Prime Minister of India.
  • The Prime Minister serves as the ex-officio chairman, providing leadership and guidance to the institution.
  • NITI Aayog was established to promote cooperative federalism and policy planning with active involvement of states.
  • The Vice Chairman and full-time members handle the daily functioning of the Aayog.
  • This structure ensures that the highest level of political leadership is directly involved in the planning process.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog replaced the Planning Commission in 2015.
  • It focuses on strategic policy frameworks rather than fixed five-year plans.

question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with reference to NITI Aayog?

NITI Aayog has been established as a think tank to assist the government.

2. Participation of the Central Government and State Governments in NITI Aayog will promote cooperative federalism.

3. The Chairman of NITI Aayog is the Prime Minister of India.

Code:
option_1: (a) Only 3
option_2: (b) 1 and 3
option_3: (c) 1 and 2
option_4: (d) 1,2 and 3
solution:
• All three statements regarding NITI Aayog are correct:
    1. NITI Aayog has been established as a think tank to assist the government in policy-making and economic planning.
    2. The participation of both Central and State Governments in NITI Aayog promotes cooperative federalism, ensuring collaborative decision-making.
    3. The Chairman of NITI Aayog is the Prime Minister of India, providing leadership at the highest level.
  • These features make NITI Aayog a key institution for inclusive and flexible governance in India.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog replaced the Planning Commission in 2015 to better accommodate the evolving federal structure.
  • It encourages bottom-up planning and innovation.

question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with reference to NITI Aayog?

The nature of NITI Aayog is decentralized.

2. The Central Government and the Governments of all the States participate in policy making and implementation in NITI Aayog.

3. Experts from universities and research institutes are also involved in the formulation of plans and policies in NITI Aayog.

Select the correct answer using the code given below:
option_1: (a) Only 2
option_2: (b) 1 and 2
option_3: (c) Only 1
option_4: (d) 1,2 and 3
solution:
• All three statements about NITI Aayog are correct:
    1. The nature of NITI Aayog is decentralized, allowing states to have greater involvement in planning and policy decisions.
    2. Both the Central Government and all State Governments participate in policy making and implementation through NITI Aayog, fostering cooperative federalism.
    3. Experts from universities and research institutes are also involved in formulating plans and policies, ensuring evidence-based decision making.
  • This inclusive and collaborative approach distinguishes NITI Aayog from the earlier Planning Commission.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog was created to promote bottom-up planning and innovation.
  • It acts as a platform for knowledge sharing and policy coordination among various stakeholders.

question:
Planning was considered prerequisite-

For balanced socio-economic development

2. To spread the benefits of development uniformly

3. To focus on removing regional disparities

4. To optimize the use of available resources

Select the correct answer from the code given below:

UPPSC (Pre), 2009
option_1: (a) 1 and 2
option_2: (b) 1,2 and 3
option_3: (c) 2,3 and 4
option_4: (d) All of the above
solution:
• Planning in India was considered a prerequisite for all the following reasons:
    1. To achieve balanced socio-economic development across regions and communities.
    2. To spread the benefits of development uniformly so that no section of society is left behind.
    3. To focus on removing regional disparities and promote equitable growth.
    4. To optimize the use of available resources efficiently and sustainably.
  • Thus, all four points highlight the comprehensive objectives of planning in India.

Additional Information:

  • These objectives were central to the formulation of India’s Five Year Plans.
  • Planning aimed to address inequalities and ensure inclusive growth.

question:
Consider the following statements:

The National Development Council is a part of the Planning Commission.

2. Economic and social planning is placed in the Concurrent List of the Constitution of India.

3. The Constitution of India states that Panchayats should be entrusted with the task of planning for economic development and social justice.

Which of the above statements is/are correct?

IAS, 2013
option_1: (a) Only 1
option_2: (b) Only 2 and 3
option_3: (c) Only 1 and 3
option_4: (d) 1,2 and 3
solution:
• Statement 1 is incorrect: The National Development Council (NDC) is not a part of the Planning Commission; it is a separate constitutional body that approves the plans prepared by the Planning Commission.
  • Statement 2 is correct:Economic and social planning is included in the Concurrent List of the Indian Constitution, meaning both the Centre and States can legislate on it.
  • Statement 3 is correct: The Constitution mandates that Panchayats should be entrusted with the responsibility of planning for economic development and social justice as per the 73rd Amendment.
  • Therefore, only statements 2 and 3 are correct.

Additional Information:

  • The NDC acts as an advisory and coordinating forum between the Centre and States.
  • Panchayati Raj institutions play a key role in decentralized planning and local governance.

question: The Mahalanobis Model focused on a two-sector economy. Which sectors did it emphasize for rapid growth?
option_2: Heavy Industries and Consumer Goods
option_3: Capital Goods and Consumer Goods
option_4: Public Sector and Private Sector
solution:
• The Mahalanobis Model focused on a two-sector economy emphasizing:
    • Capital Goods Sector
    • Consumer Goods Sector
  • The model, developed by P.C. Mahalanobis, aimed at rapid industrialization through building a strong capital goods industry that would support the production of consumer goods.
  • It prioritized investment in the capital goods sector to create the infrastructure necessary for sustained growth.
  • The consumer goods sector was also important but was expected to grow as a result of the capital goods sector expansion.

Additional Information:

  • The model was the basis for India’s Second Five Year Plan.
  • It marked a strategic shift toward self-reliance and import substitution.

question: Which Five Year Plan first introduced the approach of ‘Growth with Stability’ aiming to control inflation while increasing output?
option_1: Third Five Year Plan
option_2: Fourth Five Year Plan
option_3: Fifth Five Year Plan
option_4: Sixth Five Year Plan
solution:
• The Fourth Five Year Plan (1969-1974) first introduced the approach of ‘Growth with Stability’.
  • The plan aimed at achieving a balance between economic growth and price stability to control inflation while increasing output.
  • It focused on reducing inflationary pressures and maintaining steady growth rates.
  • The plan also emphasized self-reliance and improving productivity.
  • This was a shift from earlier plans that prioritized rapid growth without as much emphasis on stability.

Additional Information:

  • The Fourth Plan faced challenges like wars and food shortages but laid the foundation for controlled growth policies.
  • It also aimed at reducing unemployment and poverty alongside growth.

question: During which plan was the ‘Rolling Plan’ system first implemented, allowing more flexibility in economic planning?
option_3: Between Fifth and Sixth Five Year Plan
solution:
• The ‘Rolling Plan’ system was first implemented between the Fifth and Sixth Five Year Plans.
  • This approach allowed for more flexibility in economic planning by continuously updating and revising plans based on changing economic conditions.
  • The Rolling Plan replaced rigid fixed-term planning, enabling adaptation to unforeseen circumstances.
  • It was introduced to make the planning process more responsive and dynamic.
  • This system marked a shift from traditional fixed-period Five Year Plans to a more flexible framework.

Additional Information:

  • The Rolling Plan concept was used during the late 1970s and early 1980s.
  • It helped India adjust plans according to economic and political changes.

question: The ‘Kuznets Inverted U Hypothesis’ regarding inequality was considered in the evaluation of which Five Year Plan’s impact?
option_1: Third Five Year Plan
option_2: Fourth Five Year Plan
option_3: Fifth Five Year Plan
option_4: Sixth Five Year Plan
solution:
• The ‘Kuznets Inverted U Hypothesis’ regarding inequality was considered during the evaluation of the Sixth Five Year Plan (1980-1985).
  • This hypothesis suggests that inequality tends to increase in the early stages of economic development and decreases after a certain average income level is reached, forming an inverted U-shaped curve.
  • The Sixth Plan evaluation analyzed economic growth alongside social equity and income distribution patterns.
  • It recognized the importance of addressing inequality while pursuing growth.
  • This period marked increased attention to inclusive development and poverty reduction.

Additional Information:

  • The hypothesis was developed by economist Simon Kuznets.
  • The Sixth Plan aimed to balance growth with social justice.

question: Which Five Year Plan laid emphasis on ‘Basic Minimum Needs’ including housing, drinking water, and education?
solution:
The Correct Answer is: Fifth Five Year Plan ✅

Explanation:

The concept of Basic Minimum Needs (BMN) was introduced in the Fifth Five Year Plan (1974–1979).
This plan emphasized improving the quality of life of the poor by focusing on:

  • Rural health
  • Primary education
  • Rural roads
  • Safe drinking water
  • Rural housing
  • Nutrition

The objective was to ensure that every citizen had access to basic services necessary for a decent living standard.

Note: While the Seventh Plan (1985–1990) also talked about social justice and human resource development, the specific emphasis on Basic Minimum Needs originated in the Fifth Plan.

question: The Planning Commission was replaced by NITI Aayog in which year, marking a shift from centralized planning?
solution:
• The Planning Commission was replaced by NITI Aayog in the year 2015.
  • This change marked a shift from centralized planning to a more decentralized and cooperative federalism-based approach.
  • NITI Aayog focuses on involving states in policy-making and long-term strategic planning rather than rigid Five Year Plans.
  • The replacement aimed to address the limitations of the Planning Commission and adapt to India’s evolving economic and political landscape.
  • The transition was officially made on 1st January 2015.

Additional Information:

  • NITI Aayog stands for National Institution for Transforming India.
  • It encourages innovation, bottom-up planning, and better coordination between Centre and states.
